member.name: T:Csv.CsvLineSplitter
member.summary: Splits a single line (multiline handling is done independently) into multiple parts

member.name: T:Csv.CsvOptions
member.summary: Defines the options that can be passed to customize the reading or writing of csv files.
member.remarks: Do not reuse an instance of for multiple reads or writes.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.RowsToSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows to skip before reading the header row, defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.SkipRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a function to skip the current row based on its raw string value or 1-based index. Skips empty rows and rows starting with # by default.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Separator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use for separating data, defaults to '\0' which will auto-detect from the header row.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.TrimData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data should be trimmed when accessed, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Comparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparer to use when looking up header names.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.HeaderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets an indicator to the parser to expect a header row or not, defaults to .

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.ValidateColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a row should be validated immediately that the column count matches the header count, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.ReturnEmptyForMissingColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets whether an empty string is returned for a missing column, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.Aliases
member.summary: Can be used to use multiple names for a single column. (e.g. to allow "CategoryName", "Category Name", "Category-Name")
member.remarks: A group with no matches is ignored.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowNewLineInEnclosedFieldValues
member.summary: Respects new line (either \r\n or \n) characters inside field values enclosed in double quotes, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowBackSlashToEscapeQuote
member.summary: Allows the sequence "\"" to be a valid quoted value (in addition to the standard """"), defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.AllowSingleQuoteToEncloseFieldValues
member.summary: Allows the single-quote character to be used to enclose field values, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Csv.CsvOptions.NewLine
member.summary: The new line string to use when multiline field values are read, defaults to .
member.remarks: Requires to be set to true for this to have any effect.

member.name: T:Csv.CsvReader
member.summary: Helper class to read csv (comma separated values) data.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.Read(System.IO.TextReader,Csv.CsvOptions)
member.summary: Reads the lines from the reader.
member.param: The text reader to read the data from.
The optional options to use when reading.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.ReadFromStream(System.IO.Stream,Csv.CsvOptions)
member.summary: Reads the lines from the stream.
member.param: The stream to read the data from.
The optional options to use when reading.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.ReadFromText(System.String,Csv.CsvOptions)
member.summary: Reads the lines from the csv string.
member.param: The csv string to read the data from.
The optional options to use when reading.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.GetColumn``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Csv.ICsvLine},System.Int32,System.Func{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Gets a single column from the entire Enumeration of `ICsvLine`
member.param: The enumeration of `ICsvLine`
The index (starting from 0) of the the column to extract
The transformation function to parse from the string values
member.typeparam: The datatype to transform the string inputs into
member.returns: An enumeration of the transformed values of the selected column

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.GetColumn(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Csv.ICsvLine},System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a single column from the entire Enumeration of `ICsvLine`
member.param: The enumeration of `ICsvLine`
The index (starting from 0) of the the column to extract
member.returns: An enumerations of the string values of the selected column

member.name: M:Csv.CsvReader.GetBlock(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Csv.ICsvLine},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a range/block of values from the given enumeration of `ICsvLine`
member.param: The enumeration of `ICsvLine`
The index(starting from 0) of the rows to start the capture of. Default value is -1
The number of rows to capture from the start row. If the default value (or any negative number) is passed, selects all the rows till the end
The index(starting from 0) of all the columns to start the capture of.
The number of rows to capture from the start column. If the default value (or any negative number) is passed, selects all the rows till the end

member.name: T:Csv.CsvWriter
member.summary: Helper class to write csv (comma separated values) data.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvWriter.Write(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String[]},System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the lines to the writer.
member.param: The text writer to write the data to.
The headers that should be used for the first line, determines the number of columns.
The lines with data that should be written.
The separator to use between columns (comma, semicolon, tab, ...)
Indicate whether the header row should be skipped, defaults to false.

member.name: M:Csv.CsvWriter.WriteToText(System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String[]},System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the lines and return the result.
member.param: The headers that should be used for the first line, determines the number of columns.
The lines with data that should be written.
The separator to use between columns (comma, semicolon, tab, ...)
Indicate whether the header row should be skipped, defaults to false.

member.name: T:Csv.HeaderMode
member.summary: Indicates the presence (default) or absence of a header row.

member.name: F:Csv.HeaderMode.HeaderPresent
member.summary: Indicates that the CSV file has a header row. (Default)

member.name: F:Csv.HeaderMode.HeaderAbsent
member.summary: Indicates that the CSV file does not have a header row.

member.name: T:Csv.ICsvLine
member.summary: Represents a single data line inside a csv file.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Headers
member.summary: Gets the headers from the csv file.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Values
member.summary: Gets a list of values in string format for the current row.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Raw
member.summary: Gets the original raw content of the line.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Index
member.summary: Gets the 1-based index for the line inside the file.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets the number of columns of the line.

member.name: M:Csv.ICsvLine.HasColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified exists.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the data for the specified named header.
member.param: The name of the header.

member.name: P:Csv.ICsvLine.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the data for the specified indexed header.
member.param: The index of the header.
